title: Clash and Honor
body: When the honor system first came out I like everyone else was placed at honor 2 and I wasn't toxic nor was I leaving games, note I never promoted from honor 2 for reasons I do not know why and it was very frustrating because all the people I knew were leveling up in honor. So some time went by and I stopped caring about watching what I was saying or what it felt to other people of what I was saying. One day I got a chat restriction I was pretty bummed about it but knew that I shouldn't have said what I said, so I was dropped to honor 0 and ever since I haven't talked in chat and if I did it was to say good job or something informational (like top no flash). I never leveled up after and still remain at level 0 and I think I will never level up in order to actually play clash which to me seems really cool. I sometimes feel like the honor system leveling up just doesn't work for me, but it could just be my imagination. I do have one question do the honor levels get reset each season?

replies.body:
> I do have one question do the honor levels get reset each season?

https://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/client-new-features-feedback/HIZAeknK-honor-season-2018-on-pbe

TLDR;

Honor levels lowered due to penalty will not be reset to a higher value.

Thank you for answering the question. Sorry to bother with another but for someone that was honor 2 but dropped down to honor 0 would it take longer for them to get to 1 then someone that got to 3?
Recently I've tried not to say much in chat but when I do I try to make it good.
I know there probably is a few games were I said something

> would it take longer for them to get to 1 then someone that got to 3

This is a little difficult to answer, and the clarity around it feels bad from a player perspective. It's something we are looking to make better.

It's going to depend on your penalty. But it may help to think of Honor 0 and 1 as special cases, and the level from 3-5 is a consistent experience. Exhibiting genuine sportsmanship will see you through the system faster.

I'm going to go ahead and have to say that the system as it is makes negative minded players lose hope even more so which does illicit more negative behavior from them. This problem should probably be something that's worked on quicker than other things to improve the morale of the community and hopefully give reformed players a reason to stay reformed rather than give up.

There is a lot of reason for people to improve. All players, even players in level 0 and 1, will now have checkpoints. This will create a lot more clarity about the leveling process.

Certainly open to suggestions.

I'm not sure how much good it would do, but maybe giving players a advance reform card if they're in lower levels of Honor - if they get a valid report that is going to slow their increase, maybe let them know? I get that this may give a little too much info out than you'd like, though, so I understand if it isn't implemented.

Alternatively, maybe keep a tally on their profile of how many games have slowed their honor progress? With/without info, but just a tally maybe?

----
Personally I think the biggest clarity issue is that players don't know when their honor progress is being slowed at any level, but especially those that have been punished don't generally understand that if their behavior doesn't improve they won't progress, even if they aren't getting punished more.

Question of clarity on Honors.

If they moved from Honors0 to Honors1 (from a 14-day ban), does that mean they have dropped a punishment tier (i.e their next punishment will be a 14-day ban again, instead of a permaban).

Yes / No answer will be suffice, if things change in the future, we as the community can adjust the information we give out.

This is a little bit off-topic, but have you ever considered implementing a reward system specific to those that have had their honor taken due to chat penalties or bans? For example: an unlockable emote for any player who has risen from dishonorable status to honor level 3 or higher. Something to signify their efforts in reforming their behavior. I feel like rewarding players is a much better way to motivate them to behave better than threatening escalating punishments and eventual permabans. (Just my 2 cents on this somewhat related topic.)
